page.title: 04Great Ryburgh Village Store
page.content: The shop stands in a row of Grade III listed buildings built between 1650 and 1680. It has storage and living accomodation,and is owned by the shopkeeper. {Opening hours}are from 8.30am to 6.00pm each day, except Wednesday (8.30am to 1.00pm) and Sunday (9.00am to 1.00pm). The shopkeeper works 60 hours a week in the shop, and 2 hours a week doing accounts and VAT returns. The shop sells mainly groceries with some hardware, greetings cards and toys, and a wide range of sweets which attract the schoolchildren. The custom is mostly from Great Ryburgh, averaging 500 "till-rings" a week. The shop belongs to the{Spar Guild}to which the owner pays Â£15 a week for assistance with stock purchase and promotional lines. Bread, cakes and greengoceries are delivered regularly.
